feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: A line of thunderstorms producing heavy rain and marble sized hail continue to move slowly south and west over Fairbanks and North Pole areas this evening. Ponding of water on roadways and in low lying areas has been reported with this line of storms. This line of storms is expected to move south of the Fairbanks and North Pole area by 8 PM.

entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Wasatch...southeastern Salt Lake and central Utah Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 935 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eagle Mountain to Woodland Hills. Movement was northeast at 25 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Salt Lake Valley; Utah Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs

cap:geocode.value: UTZ101 UTZ105 UTZ106 UTZ108 UTZ110 UTZ111 UTZ113

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Salt Lake...western Utah and east central Tooele Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 929 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ophir, or 11 miles southeast of Tooele, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 7:24PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following counties, Garfield and Iron. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows on area burn scars caused by excessive rainfall remains possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Eastern Juab/Millard Counties, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Tooele and Rush Valleys, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Mountains; Eastern Juab, Millard Counties; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains

In

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 01 at 8:13PM PDT until August 02 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AGAIN ON TUESDAY... .Isolated thunderstorms with abundant lightning have been observed in south central Oregon, and outflow winds may affect Crook and Grant Counties this evening. Winds will be breezy across the Kittitas Valley, the eastern Columbia River Gorge, and the Lower Columbia Basin on Tuesday.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 01 at 3:25PM PDT until August 01 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DRY AND BREEZY MONDAY AND TUESDAY... .Monday will deliver another day of triple digit heat before the upper-level ridge begins to weaken and flatten. The breakdown of the ridge will promote breezy winds and potential for several hours of critical wind and humidity levels each afternoon and early evening. Strongest winds on Monday will be in the foothills
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colville Reservation; Methow Valley; Okanogan Valley
